newsitem.title: UK: U.S. Treasuries idle in London ahead of auction.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Treasuries idle in London ahead of auction.

text.p: U.S. Treasuries traded in London were steady on Monday, although there were some indications that investors are eyeing switching positions out of Europe into the U.S., traders said.
While analysts said this could be a good trade, they said there was further downside potential in Treasuries before a rally emerges.

"It's a tempting idea, but I think it's premature," said Teis Knuthsen, international economist at First Chicago in London. "The next big bull market is likely to be the U.S, but there will be further losses before they go up."
The U.S. 30-year long bond at 94-21 in London by 1025 GMT, yielding 7.057 percent compared with 94-21 in Tokyo and 94-22 at the New York close.
June T-bond futures were up 2/32 at 108-02 in automated trade.
"The market's holding in quite well," said a trade at a French house in London. "But there's a very light calendar this week, with only the auction providing much interest."
No major data were scheduled for release this session, and the market was expected to trade in a narrow range, traders said.

The U.S. Treasury will auction $17.0 billion of two-year notes on Tuesday, and $12.5 billion of five-year notes on Wednesday. Later on Monday $12.0 billion of three- and six-month paper will be auctioned.
"There is unlikely to be any problem absorbing this supply," said Knuthsen. "There may even be a relief rally afterwards."
Treasuries were unlikely to rally until monetary policy was tighter, he said although downside could be limited.
He said the one to two year lag in the economy's reaction to a rate hike meant that the quarter percentage point rise seen in March was not expected to do much to cool the economy.
"It will take more than a quarter-point to stop the U.S. supertanker," he said. "I expect the Fed funds to be at 6.0 percent by the year end."
Fed funds rate is currently at 5.50 percent.

In the futures market, the trader said some investors had closed out their call options around the 108-00 level on Friday. There is some upside potential to 108-09, and if it gets through there then it will test 108-16, and 109-00.
